review: Good product especially if you got in on the amazon Prime deal. Took a while to arrive but setup a breeze. Yes, screens are skewed towards amazon offerings but it is the AMAZON Fire TV Stick so what do you expect. Still manage to get Netflix easily and awesome for hotels with free wifi when I gotta have my own in-bed movie/TV faves. Other issue is that depending on the TV, screen may not "fit" so you may have to adjust screen size repeatedly- means you gotta have the original remote for your tv handy. Also, now that DISH provides free Netflix app for, may not be as handy since I tend to watch more Netflix than Amazon Prime.
author: Ip Lady

review: Not really a fan, I've had the Fire stick for a month.  It's so geared towards Amazon that it's hard to find the APP's you want. Most APP's that are on the Roku and not on the Fire. The phone remote voice APP doesn't work.  I have messed with that for hours.The Fire home page never changes.  It's that same old stuff on the HP.  It needs more selection.  It's as if Amazon's trying to push their shows and products. It really needs some variety.***I do have something nice to say about the Fire.  I love how it links to my music prime.  I can play it from my TV while doing dishes or cleaning.  It's not like the Roku which is limited with it come to play AP music.I still prefer the Roku.
